title: What is Anypoint Monitoring?
content: Anypoint Monitoring provides unparalleled visibility, which helps us proactively identify issues and reduce mean time to resolution. It's a game-changer.

title: What is Functional Monitoring?
content: API Functional Monitoring enables you to monitor responses to requests sent to API resources at their endpoints

title: What is Performance Monitoring?
content: Graphical representation of AP Response Time, Failures

title: What is VPC / Charectaristics / Advantages?
content: VPC- Virtual private cloud and it allows you to create a logical or isolated network in the cloud where you can deploy or run resources securely.
point1: Any point VPC allows you to create a isolated network where u can host the workers or mule applications.
point2: Any point VPC allows you to extend your corporate network and allows cloud hub workers to connect resources behind the firewall.
point3:
characterstics
-> Multiple VPCs can be created in the same region
-> All non pod environment can be mapped to Non prod VPC and prod environment to Prod VPC
-> Always create VPC in the parent business group and share with the sub business groups
point4:
Advantages
-> Create a secure virtual network within cloudhub
-> Connect cloud hub to assests behind the firewall
-> Connect cloudhub to any public cloud or On prem data centers securely

title: What is VPN / Routing?
content: Its a Virtual private network and it creates a secure connection b/w cloudhub and data centers
point1: Any point VPN supports site to site IP Sec conections
point2: Types of VPN Routing 1. Dynamic Routing 2. Static Routing
point3: Dynamic Routing: your device uses border gateway protocol to advertise routes to Anypoint VPN.Use BGP routing if ur device support this protocol
point4: Static Routing: Requires you to specify the routes in your network that are accessible through anypoint VPN.
point5: *** A maximum of 95 route table entries is permitted per VPC reagardless of the number of VPN connections.

title: What is CIDR?
content: * Class less inter domain routing, It is a way of allocating IP Adrs or host name in the most efficient manner
point1: It replaces the old way of allocating IP adrs on based of class system.
point2: this method of allocation avoids the waste of IP adrs.

title: What is IP Address / Subnet?
content: It consists of 2 bits (1-Network address, 2-Host address) IPV4/IPV6
point1: Subnet: It is a logical subdivision of IP network.The practice of divisioning a network into 2 or more networks is called Subnetting.

title: What is Load Balancer?
content: Load balancer is a device that acts as a proxy and distributes network or application traffic across a number of servers.
point1: We do have 2 types 1: Shared Load Balance 2. Dedicated Load Balancer
point2:
Shared Balancer: provides a basic load balancing functionality
* Cloudhub provides a default shared load balancer that is available in all environments
point3:
* These doesn't allow you to configure custom SSL certificates or proxy rules
* Anypoint VPC is a optional to use a shared load balancer
point4: Dedicated Load Balancer: enables you to deploy and configure one or more custom load balancers within an anypoint VPC
point5: * Need to purchase DLB these are optional component of Anypoint platform
point6: * Define SSL configurations to provide custom certificates and optionally enforce 2 way SSL client aunthentication.

title: What is connector in mulesoft?
content: A connector provides connectivity to other applications and / or protocols.
point1: It is in charge of controlling the usuage of particular protocol.
point2: In Mule we have 1) Endpoint based or 2) Operation based
point3: Endpoint based: These connectors follow either a one-way or request response exchange pattern and are often named and based around a standard protocol,such as FTP and SMTP.
point4: Operation based: These connectors follow an information exchange pattern based on the operation that you select and are often named and based around one or more specific third parties APIS.

title: what is Vcore?
content: Vcore is unit of Compute capacity for procesing on cloudhub,which is equal to one virtual core.
point1: Upto a 10 mule applications can be deployed for every Vcore purchased.

title: What is Worker?
content: Worker is a dedicated instances of mule runtime engine that run ur integration applications on cloudhub.
point1: it has 4 characteristics 1. Capacity 2. Isolation 3: Managibility 4: Locality
point2: Capacity: Each worker has a specific amount of capacity to process data. you can select size of workers to configuration applications.
point3: Isolation: Each worker runs in a specific container from every other application.
point4: Managibility: Each worker is deployed and monitoried independently.
point5: Locality: Each worker runs in a specific worker cloud.such as US, EU, or Asia-Pacific.

title: What is Exchange?
content: A platform for collabrating with public,private,reusable assets.
point1: Exchange -  Anypoint exchange is a curated catalog of reusable assets such as APIS, policies, API  spec fragments, API groups,Templates, Examples, custom assets, and integration assets such as connectors.
point2: ->Exchange assets are accessible from many places like Anypoint studio(connectors), API manager(Apigroups, policies),
point3: -> or Runtime manager(Applications). APIs can be published from design cenetr to Exchange.

title: Mulesoft On-prem instances restarting?
content: We took multiple sample of thread and heap dumps. From the heap dump we saw that a DB query was holding 1.8GB and fetched 680k records.
point1: -> We were able to track that app that is causing this issue.
point2: -> The issue we found was the affected server was still having the incorrect version of the code. Rest of the servers were having the correct version of the code. This incorrect version of the code was causing the high memory consumption causing the frequent GC, the JVM was unresponsive and restarting the JVM.
point3: -> Next Steps, You will redeploy the correct version of the code again on the server that should fix the issue.

title: How can we improve the performance of the Mule Application in MuleSoft?
content: -> Keeping the data validation at the start of the flow.
point2: -> Save the results of the application and reuse them later.
point3: -> Process data asynchronously wherever is possible.

title: Installation of ONPREM steps from scratch?
content:
-> 1 Download the Mule 4.2 standlone runtime
-> 2 Extract the downloaded mule 4.2 standlone runtimezip file in your root directory
-> 3 Go to runtime manager click add servers and copy the command
point1:
-> 4 It will be executed in the Onprem server to install mule agent and establish the communication between the ONPEM mule 4 runtime and anypoint platform control panel
-> 5 Execute the amc set up command on Bin path of standlone,
point2:
-> 6 after that execute mule.bat command
-> 7 deploy the app in ANYPoint studio and copy the executed jar file
point3:
-> 8 runtime manager 1)select Applications 2)select deployment target 3) upload the copied jar file
-> 9 Deploy the application.

title: What is IP whitelisting?
content: IP Whitelist policy allows a list or range of IP addresses to access and interacts with a configured API endpoint.

title: Explain about JWT validation policy?
content: The JWT (JSON Web Token) validation policy on api manager to protect the MuleSoft resources, it is one of the security policy available in MuleSoft API Manager

title: Why we used Anypoint VPN?
content: We use Anypoint VPN to create a secure connection between MuleSoft VPC and on-premise network.

title: How to achieve clustering in MuleSoft?
content: You can achieve this by adding multiple workers to your application to make it horizontally scale.
point2: -> Clustering is a group of servers or mule runtime which acts as a single unit.
point3: ->  Mulesoft Enterprise Edition supports scalable clustering to provide high availability for the Mulesoft application There are two types of Clustering in MuleSoft.
point5: A unicast cluster requires that you configure the IP addresses of the nodes in the cluster. If a server has multiple interfaces, use the internal IP address that allows the node to communicate directly with other nodes.
point6:
A multicast cluster comprises servers that automatically detect each other. Servers that are part of a multicast cluster must be on the same network segment.
Benifits of Clustering?
-> improves application performance by dividing the workload between nodes in the cluster
-> Automatic load balancing of processing within a cluster.
-> Improve Performance, Automatic Failover, High Availability.

title: Can you disable the CloudHub Logs?
content: Yes, in that case only the system logs are available in Runtime Manager.

title: What is API Gateway?
content: API Gateway is embedded inside mule runtime, using this gateway any user can apply basic authentication policy on top of Mule application.

title: What is the difference between Throttling and Rate Limiting?
content: Rate Limiting and Throttling are the API Policies available in MuleSoft, you can apply these policies through API Manager.
point1: A) Rate Limiting: The Rate Limiting policy limits the number of requests an API accepts within a window of time. The API rejects requests that exceed the limit
point2: B) Throttling: The Throttling policy queues requests that exceed limits for possible processing in a subsequent window. The API eventually rejects the request if processing cannot occur after a certain number of attempts. You can configure a delay between retries, as well as limit the number of retries.

title: What is functional monitoring?
content: API Functional Monitoring is a mechanism to ensure that APIs deployed are performing as per the required functional and performance expectations.

title: What is Apigee API gateway?
content: the API gateway and make it easier to produce and deploy modern, developer-friendly apps. Developers creating connected apps.

title: What is object store V2?
content: Object Store v2 lets Cloudhub applications store data and states across batch processes.

title: What is Anypoint MQ? Are you using it?
content: Used to Send or receive messages from any Mule application running in the cloud or on-premises. Easily interface with non-Mule applications using Anypoint MQ REST APIs.

title: What is Mule ESB?
content: Mule ESB makes it easy for the development teams to flexibly connect, access, and exchange data easily.

title: What is API Manager?
content: API Manager is a management tool that allows organizations in managing users, traffic, and service level agreements.

title: What is CICD Tool you are using?
content: JENKINS - For Continous Integration & Continous Delivery, its a development practice that requires developers to integrate code into shared repository several times a day

title: The maximum number of controller nodes supported?
The maximum number of worker nodes supported?
what is Secrets Manager?
content: Anypoint Runtime Fabric relies completely on Secrets Manager to enable inbound communications over HTTPs. Secrets Manager needs to be configured for KeyStore and TLS Context for 2-way SSL communication

title: What is a Mule transformer?
content: A Mule transformer is used to strictly enforce the types of data it receives and its outputs

title: What is RTF runtime fabric?
content: Anypoint Runtime Fabric is a container service that automates the deployment and orchestration of your Mule applications and gateways.
point1: ->Runtime Fabric runs on customer-managed infrastructure on AWS, Azure, virtual machines (VMs) or bare-metal servers.
point3: You can scale your mule application
point4: There is option to run multiple version of mule runtime on same set of resources
point5: Isolation between application by running a separate Mule runtime per application
